gov.nasa.arc.mct.components
Interface PropertyEditor<E>

Type Parameters:
E - collection element data type
All Known Implementing Classes:
TextInitializer
public interface PropertyEditor<E>

Provides values for inspectable fields. Validates the values. java's PropertyEditorSupport implements a similar API.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getAsText()
          Gets the property value as text.

          .Get a tag list.

Method Detail

getAsText

java.lang.String getAsText()
Gets the property value as text.

Returns:
the property value as text

setAsText

void setAsText(java.lang.String text)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Set the property value by parsing a given String. Implementations should override this method to provide MCT component-specific operations such as business model updates and field validation. If a prospective field value is not valid, the implementation should throw an exception.

Parameters:
text - the new text
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - upon error, typically used for validity checking

getValue

java.lang.Object getValue()
Gets the property value.

Returns:
the value

setValue

void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Set (or change) the object that is to be edited.

Parameters:
value - the new value
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - upon error, typically used for validity checking

getTags

java.util.List<E> getTags()
.Get a tag list. If the property value must be one of a set of known tagged values, then this method should return an array of the tags.

Returns:
a list of values for the property
